Case reference: 2012020168.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area near Chase, approximately 300 meters east of Highway 446, 2 km north of Squilax Bridge.

Teeth: Visible Missing, This male was missing a number of teeth prior to his death and had poor dental health
Socks: Cotton, White, Black, athletic/sport, black stripe
Shoes: Leather, Tan, loafers, size 9.5 or 10 mens
Pants: Cotton, Blue, casual, size 32, South Channel
Jewelry: Metal, Blue, White, a square pin with Expo 86
Fractured/Broken Bones: Nose, Healed nasal septum fracture likely causing breathing problems and a bump on right side of nose

Case reference: 2005003399.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2004, an unidentified man was recovered from the Whirlpool in the Lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs. and his length was measured at 6'0", however these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. This male is uncircumcised, and his appendix is present. It is believed that this individual had been in the water for less than 3 weeks but it is also possible that the body could have been in the water over the winter.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Few strands a couple of inches long
Teeth: Natural teeth with extensive dental restorations

Case reference: 2016047824.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2016, Marie-Claude Hebert was last seen leaving her residence, on foot, on St-Calixte Street in Plessisville, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Sweater: Cotton, Black, Unknown logo on the front

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Mark: Mouth, Wart on inside of mouth

Case reference: 2014005032.CaseDesc: Edward Dufresne was last seen on 12 April 1993 at his home in Ste-Félicité, Quebec. He lived alone in a small house on Route 132. Edward regularly walked along the roads, picked mussels by the water, and also went into the forest to hunt for small game.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With keys tied to a string

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2016008385.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Destiny Kazibwe was last seen at her school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Destiny's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Destiny and Adam.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Destiny or of her brother Adam.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 2006001599.CaseDesc:
On July 15, 1992, the remains of an adult male, were found in the basement apartment of an abandoned residential building on 1348 Yonge Street in Toronto. 
There were multiple whiskey and wine bottles found around him as well as multiple cigarette butts. Based on autopsy findings and an LCBO receipt dated November 1990, it is believed that this individual had been dead for 10-18 months prior to discovery.

Teeth: Poor dental hygiene with numerous dental cavities and abscesses. He has some amalgam fillings that appear to be quite old.
Jacket: Blue, "Mark's Work Wearhouse" brand winter coat
Scar: Previous brain surgery on the right side of his head. (Craniotomy)

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: On November 4, 1991, Montreal Police received a complaint from Mr. Katnick reporting that his daughter Leslie Anne Katnick was missing. Leslie Katnick had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that a Leslie Katnick registered into the Halifax YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie Katnick. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2014004730.CaseDesc: Geoffry MacGibbon was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. In 1978, Geoffrey and his family moved to Toronto, Ontario from Quebec. He is schizophrenic and has been in several mental institutions in Canada and the United States of America.

Scar: Front Of Neck, Tracheostomy scar on throat

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2022052659.CaseDesc: On October 16, 2022, Bradley Kiefer was seen for the last time by his family in Medicine Hat, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, all of Bradley’s personal belongings, and vehicle were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2021047301.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2001, Margarito Perez-Hernandez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006313.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 13, 2013, Carey Cadeau left his residence in Chelmsford. He did not go to work that day, and was reported missing. It is believed he left home on foot. He may still be in the Chelmsford area.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, angel wings with black and grey scripture

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2017000313.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1999, the burned body of a male was found in a garage fire in downtown Edmonton. The individual may have had a slightly deformed nose from an old fracture.

Case reference: 2016068333.CaseDesc: This left humerus (upper arm bone) was located in approximately 47 feet of water and 19 minutes from the shore in the Niagara River, approximately 1 km north of East/West Line in Niagara-on-the-Lake. Dive teams failed to locate any further remains. The bone is from a male, possibly black. The remains have been in the water for an extended period of time (5 to 25 years).

Case reference: 2020011116.CaseDesc: Glen Peddle had been hitchhiking through the United States between 1982 and 1985. In April 1985, Glen called his mother from New York to tell her that he was planning on returning home to Newfoundland in the spring, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014003100.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1995, Jacob Sallenback was seen for the last time at his residence in Calgary, AB.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, JEAN, Kings Crew Colours

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination

Case reference: 2014002535.CaseDesc: Ginette Landry was seen for the last time in Montreal on April 15, 1994. Ms. Landry would often travel for missions to help people in need.

Case reference: 2014001106.CaseDesc: A partial skull belonging to an adult male was found in a remote area, located approximately 40 km southeast of Prince George, British Columbia. He has at least one solid gold crown in his teeth that may have been visible when he smiled. It is believed he was deceased for 2-5 years prior to the skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2006011499.CaseDesc: Gordon Berg was a passenger in a boat, fishing on Sturgeon Lake about 125 km west of Armstrong, Ontario, on October 10, 1969. The boat capsized in rough water, and the occupants were thrown into the lake. He was last seen as he drifted away from the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2016061155.CaseDesc: This partial skull was found on May 22, 2013 on the Georgian Bay Shoreline, French River Provincial Park. The post-mortem interval is lengthy. The skull is that of an adult, possibly an older adult. Radiocarbon dating indicates that the individual lived at least some portion of their life between 1950 and 1963. The post-mortem interval is at least a couple of years and could be up to 60 years.

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2014003355.CaseDesc: Kelsey Brew and his friends were playing on the rocks on the shores of the Hudson Bay in Churchill. According to the witness Kelsey attempted to help another boy who had fallen in the water. As Kelsey was helping, a wave came in and he also slipped into the water. A large number of volunteers walked the shoreline and boat patrols failed to locate him. It is assumed Kelsey drowned.

Scar: Cheek, 3 on left side of face

Case reference: 2012020124.CaseDesc: On October 5, 1995, Ronald Couture was seen for the last time at approximately 7:30 a.m. when he left his home in Terrebonne, Quebec. Ronald told his wife he was heading to the south shore area of the city to look for a job. The vehicle he was driving, a white 1993 Pontiac Grand-Am bearing Quebec licence plate WGT 621, was never located. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014003406.CaseDesc: Anthony Janvier was last seen at the courthouse in Cold Lake, Alberta on April 8, 1998. He was reported missing by his mother on February 7, 2002. Anthony lived a transient lifestyle which accounts for the 4 year delay in reporting him missing.

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2017075870.CaseDesc: Andrew Jutte was last seen around September 20, 2017, in the downtown core of Vancouver, British-Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2014002600.CaseDesc: On April 10th, 1976, at approximately 3:00 am, a snowmobile carrying two adults and a young child, went through harbor ice at North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. The young child, Stella Mary Rich, was swept under the ice after falling off the snowmobile when it struck a soft spot in the ice. Her body has never been located and it is presumed she drowned.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2006011599.CaseDesc: Ervin Bollom was last seen on Obonga Lake, 30 km south of Armstrong, on October 9, 1974.  He had left in his boat to get medical help for an injured friend. His boat was found with the throttle in the "open" position.

Ring: Left Ring Finger, wedding ring - E.B. engraved on the inside
Tattoo: Left Arm, red rose with green stem and the text "true love"

Case reference: 2014005293.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 20, 1999, Abdol Hossein was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Cheek, Welts all over his face and cheek

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2014001622.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 1982, Clayton Mark Bussiere was last seen while driving his taxi cab on Lougheed Highway (Highway 7) in Mission, British Columbia. Mr. Bussiere's taxi cab, a 1978 blue Pontiac Lemans, has never been located. It is unclear as to whether or not Mr. Bussiere had a passenger at the time of his disappearance.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace up shoes; brand: Downunders
Sweater: Grey, Zippered Cardigan with Elbow Patches
Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Saint Christopher Medal necklace

Case reference: 2014004835.CaseDesc: Ashleigh Pettman was last seen on June 3 2005 in the downtown area of Kelowna, British Columbia. She had moved to Kelowna from Grand Prairie, Alberta in March 2005 to live with her grandmother. In May 2005, Ashleigh gathered her belongings and moved out of her grandmother's residence to an unknown location.

Case reference: 2014006285.CaseDesc: Philippe Guerin was reported missing from the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital on June 12, 1966. He is paralyzed on the left side as a result of having Polio at 10 years of age. He is missing his upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2016061097.CaseDesc:
On June 18, 1979, the body of an unidentified male was found in the Detroit River near Riverside Drive and Crawford Avenue in the city of Windsor, Ontario. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. 
He is believed to have been in the water for 1 week to six months.

Hair: Black, Curly, Short, Moustache, possibly `Lamb Chop`style sideburns
Teeth: Unerupted wisdom teeth, which may have been impacted.

Case reference: 2014004748.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2006, Diana “Daya” Gregory was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. On that day, Diana had planned to visit her sister, but did not show up. She is known to use the Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) when she travelled within the city, and resided in the downtown core.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2020028832.CaseDesc: On July 14th 2020, Tammy Nattaway left her Child and Family Services placement in Garden Hill, Manitoba and did not return. On or about July 18th 2021, Tammy was last seen in the community of Wasagamack First Nation, Manitoba. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020089.CaseDesc: Michel Guy Favreau lived by himself in Nipawin, Saskatchewan and was in good physical health at the time of his disappearance. Mr. Favreau suffered from depression and was on medication for that illness. The last time anyone spoke to or saw Mr. Favreau was between September 22nd and September 25th, 2011. On October 4th, 2011 his vehicle, a 1998 green Chrysler Intrepid, was observed abandoned at Carrol's Cove camp ground near Nipawin. The vehicle was locked, the keys were in the ignition and Mr. Favreau's wallet was inside. Several searches including ground, water, and air, conducted in hopes of locating him were unsuccessful.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2006009699.CaseDesc: Dwayne Lee left his residence on December 24th,1999. His vehicle was located December 26, 1999, at Gray's Beach, Thousand Island's Parkway in the Township of Leeds and Thousand Islands.

Case reference: 2008015199.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1978, Alison Mary Thomas was visiting her boyfriend in Toronto Ontario. Shortly after midnight she left his residence walking towards Yonge Street, Toronto. Alison Thomas had indicated that she was going to get a taxi cab to take her to her residence, but she never arrived. An extensive investigation was conducted by the Toronto Police Service, but to this day, Alison Thomas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005295.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2007, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Javed Hoosain was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Javed had a dispute with his mother prior to leaving his residence.

Case reference: 2014002848.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Daniel McKenzie was seen for the last time. Daniel was reported missing after he was seen leaving a taxi, and running into the wilderness along the Quebec and Labrador border.

Case reference: 2015035404.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Mr. Wilson had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm , Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm , Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2012020009.CaseDesc: Kathleen Wattley was last seen on June 13, 1992. It is unusual for Kathleen not to return home to her children. Kathleen was known to live a high risk life style.

Case reference: 2014001077.CaseDesc: On February 27, 1974, the remains of a small, middle aged Indigenous man were found collapsed on Alexander Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had no natural teeth and had a star-like scar on his left wrist.

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar
Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie was last seen at home.

Jacket: Green Orange and Yellow Plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time at her residence in north Edmonton, Alberta. Later that day, Nadia’s abandon vehicle was discovered in some bushes down the side of a hill entering Rundle Park.

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2013000061.CaseDesc: In 1996, Amanda Bartlett was living in Winnipeg, having previously resided in both Saskatoon and The Pas. Amanda was last seen by a family member at the intersection of Selkirk Ave. and Salter St. in late July, 1996. Amanda has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Case reference: 2014001301.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1999, Harold Donald Maskell was reported missing by his cousin Mike Viger. Harold’s cousin had come to visit him at his residence in Coles Island, New Brunswick, but there was no sign of him at the house. A search of the shoreline of the Canaan River returned negative results. Harold does not drive and cannot walk very far.

Shirt: Red, Plaid, Plaid; red, white, blue

Case reference: 2017034100.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2017, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Olumide Arigbede was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Following his arrival to Canada from Serbia, Bojan was employed as a mechanical engineer, and a professor at the University of Toronto. Around the time of his disappearance, Bojan had informed his family that he would not be able to contact them for an extended period of time due to unknown reasons.

Case reference: 2014001222.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1977, an unidentified man was found on the shore of Sasamat Lake in British Columbia. He had a moustache, long sideburns, and wore several unique pieces of jewelry. He would be approximately 70 years old today.

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2006023399.CaseDesc: John Allen Bowes was last seen in Nipigon, Ontario getting gasoline on August 15, 1992. He was travelling eastbound toward his home in Kingston, Ontario. Mr. Bowes usually wears a baseball cap.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2009005199.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2009, the body of a Caucasian woman was found in a small one person tent in a wooded area, in Kenora, Ontario. The investigation revealed that the deceased had at one time undergone reconstruction of the jaw. The facial bones were cut surgically and then moved, and the upper and lower jaws were re-adjusted, resulting in changes in the facial structure. It is also probable that the deceased had braces in adulthood. Spots on her lower teeth suggest that she might have been a smoker. She was believed to be in the tent for a day or two and not more than a week before she was discovered. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified woman is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Light brown almost dark blonde
Medication: a two pack of Back and Muscle pain relief pills
Underwear: Cotton, Grey, undershirt with built in sports bra and thin straps
Money: 75.00$ in Canadian bills and 2.84$ in Canadian coins
Foreign Object: Jaw, maxilla-facial surgery, wire sutures in jaw

Case reference: 2006016899.CaseDesc: Lisa Maas was last seen leaving a party in the Woodford area.

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2020024716.CaseDesc: In August 1975, David Bleaney was seen for the last time in Charleston, West Virginia, in the United States. David was born in Ontario, Canada, and had moved to the United States. During the time of his disappearance, David had failed to attend a court appearance.

Case reference: 2012020173.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1984, the body of an unidentified man was discovered east of Cypress Bowl Road, along the Skyline trail, near Mile 5 on the Hollyburn Mountain in Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2016060405.CaseDesc: On April 24, 1976, a male, believed to be between the ages of 18 to 30, was recovered from the Niagara River, near the Canadian Niagara Power Plant. He is estimated to have been in the water from 3 to 6 weeks, possibly longer.

Teeth: Good, He has good teeth and no dental restorations.

Case reference: 2008007999.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, Charles Leslie Lewis and a friend were out fishing on Gull Rock Lake approximately 10km south of Red Lake. While they were out on the lake the winds picked up and began to create large waves, which caused the boat to capsize. Mr. Lewis and his friend clung to the bottom of the boat but were pushed off several times by the waves. Mr. Lewis was washed away from the boat. As he attempted to swim back to the boat, his head kept going under water.  At one point he did not resurface.

Jacket: Canvas, Brown, Orange, Hunting - ONG shoulder patches

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.
